TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit WebMethodAttribute extends System.Attribute
Public NotInheritable Class WebMethodAttribute Inherits Attribute
public ref class WebMethodAttribute sealed : Attribute

summary.span: 向使用 ASP.NET 创建的 XML Web service 中的某个方法添加此特性后，就可以从远程 Web 客户端调用该方法。

span.span: Adding this attribute to a method within an XML Web service created using ASP.NET makes the method callable from remote Web clients.
This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类中具有此属性集的方法称为 XML Web service 方法。Methods within a class that have this attribute set are called XML Web service methods. 方法和类必须是公共的并在 ASP.NET Web 应用程序中运行。The method and class must be public and running inside an ASP.NET Web application. ## Examples 在下面的示例中 `GetMachineName` ，可以通过 Web 远程调用方法，因为它具有一个 。In the example below the method `GetMachineName` can be remotely called across the Web, because it has a . `GetUserName` 不能远程调用，因为它没有 ，即使它是 `public` 。`GetUserName` cannot be called remotely, because it does not have a , even though it is `public`. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic WebMethodAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute Example/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic WebMethodAttribute Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute Example/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks Web 服务调用只能是事务的根，因为 HTTP 协议的无状态特性。A web service call can only be the root of a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. 这意味着以下两个设置是等效的，每次调用创建一个新事务时：This means that the following two settings are equivalent, with each call creating a new transaction: ``` [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Required)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.RequiresNew)] ``` 这也意味着，所有以下设置都是等效的;也就是说，不支持事务：It also means that all the following settings are equivalent; meaning no transaction support: ``` [WebMethod] // TransactionOption.Disabled is the default [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Disabled)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.NotSupported)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.Supported)] ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks Web 服务调用只能是事务的根，因为 HTTP 协议的无状态特性。A web service call can only be the root of a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. 这意味着以下两个设置是等效的，每次调用创建一个新事务时：This means that the following two settings are equivalent, with each call creating a new transaction: ``` [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Required)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.RequiresNew)] ``` 这也意味着，所有以下设置都是等效的;也就是说，不支持事务：It also means that all the following settings are equivalent; meaning no transaction support: ``` [WebMethod] // TransactionOption.Disabled is the default [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Disabled)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.NotSupported)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.Supported)] ```

remarks.format: ## Remarks Web 服务调用只能是事务的根，因为 HTTP 协议的无状态特性。A web service call can only be the root of a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. 这意味着以下两个设置是等效的，每次调用创建一个新事务时：This means that the following two settings are equivalent, with each call creating a new transaction: ``` [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Required)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.RequiresNew)] ``` 这也意味着，所有以下设置都是等效的;也就是说，不支持事务：It also means that all the following settings are equivalent; meaning no transaction support: ``` [WebMethod] // TransactionOption.Disabled is the default [WebMethod(TransactionOption = TransactionOption.Disabled)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.NotSupported)] [WebMethod(TransactionOption = Transaction.Supported)] ```

public bool BufferResponse { get; set; }
.property instance bool BufferResponse
Public Property BufferResponse As Boolean
public: property bool BufferResponse { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.BufferResponse : bool with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置是否缓存该请求的响应。

span.span: Gets or sets whether the response for this request is buffered.

value.span: 如果缓存该请求的响应，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if the response for this request is buffered; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果将设置 为 `true` ，则会将 XML Web service 方法的响应序列化为内存缓冲区，直到响应完全序列化或缓冲区已满。Setting to `true`, serializes the response of the XML Web service method into a memory buffer until either the response is completely serialized or the buffer is full. 缓冲响应后，会通过网络将其返回到 XML Web service 客户端。Once the response is buffered, it is returned to the XML Web service client over the network. 当 为时 `false` ，对 XML Web service 方法的响应将在序列化时发送回客户端。When is `false`, the response to the XML Web service method is sent back to the client as it is serialized. 通常， `false` 如果已知 XML Web service 方法向客户端返回大量数据，则只需将设置为。In general, you only want to set to `false`, if it is known that an XML Web service method returns large amounts of data to the client. 对于较小的数据量，XML Web service 性能对于更 好 `true` 。For smaller amounts of data, XML Web service performance is better with to `true`. 当 为时 `false` ，将为 XML Web service 方法禁用 SOAP 扩展。When is `false`, SOAP extensions are disabled for the XML Web service method. ## Examples 下面的代码示例将 属性设置为 `false` ，并将文本文件的流式处理返回给客户端。The following code example sets the property to `false` and handles the streaming of a text file back to the client. 此代码示例演示如何使用实现接口的类将大量数据流式传输回客户端 。The code example demonstrates how to stream a large piece of data back to the client using a class that implements the interface. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic WebMethodAttribute.BufferResponse Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.BufferResponse Example/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic WebMethodAttribute.BufferResponse Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.BufferResponse Example/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public int CacheDuration { get; set; }
.property instance int32 CacheDuration
Public Property CacheDuration As Integer
public: property int CacheDuration { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.CacheDuration : int with get, set

summary.span: 获取或设置响应应在缓存中保留的秒数。

span.span: Gets or sets the number of seconds the response should be held in the cache.

value.span: 响应应在缓存中保留的秒数。

span.span: The number of seconds the response should be held in the cache.

value.span: 默认值为 0，表示不缓存响应。

span.span: The default is 0, which means the response is not cached.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当启用缓存时，请求和响应将保留在服务器上的内存中至少用于缓存持续时间，因此，如果您希望请求或响应非常大或者您希望请求发生变化很大，则必须谨慎使用。When caching is enabled requests and responses are held in memory on the server for at least the cache duration so caution must be used if you expect requests or responses to be very large or you expect requests to vary widely. 有两个问题可以影响 ASP.NET 2.0 Web 服务应用程序中的输出缓存。There are two issues that can affect output caching in an ASP.NET 2.0 Web service application. 在 ASP.NET 2.0 中，测试页的 HTTP 方法已从 GET 更改为 POST。In ASP.NET 2.0 the HTTP method of the test page has changed from GET to POST. 但是 POST 通常不进行缓存。However, POSTs are not normally cached. 如果在 ASP.NET 2.0 Web 服务应用程序的测试页中改为使用 GET，缓存将正常工作。If you change the test page in an ASP.NET 2.0 Web service application to use GET, caching works properly. 此外，HTTP 指示用户代理（浏览器或调用应用程序）应该可以通过将“Cache-Control”设置为“no-cache”以重写服务器缓存。In addition, HTTP indicates that a user agent (the browser or calling application) should be able to override server caching by setting the "Cache-Control" to "no-cache". 因此，当 ASP.NET 应用程序找到“no-cache”标头时，会忽略缓存的结果。ASP.NET applications, therefore, ignore cached results when they find a "no-cache" header. ## Examples 下面的示例将对缓存中的 XML Web service 方法的调用结果放 `ServiceUsage` 在60秒内。The following example places the result of the call to the `ServiceUsage` XML Web service method in the cache for 60 seconds. XML Web service 客户端 `ServiceUsage` 在该时间段内执行 XML Web service 方法时，将返回相同的结果。Any time an XML Web service client executes the `ServiceUsage` XML Web service method during that time, the same result is returned. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic WebMethodAttribute.CacheDuration Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.CacheDuration Example/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic WebMethodAttribute.CacheDuration Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.CacheDuration Example/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

summary.span: 描述 XML Web service 方法的描述性消息。

span.span: A descriptive message describing the XML Web service method.

value.span: 描述 XML Web service 方法的描述性消息。

span.span: A descriptive message describing the XML Web service method.
The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当生成 XML Web service 的说明文档时（如服务说明和服务帮助页），将在 XML Web service 的预期使用者中显示描述性消息。The descriptive message is displayed to prospective consumers of the XML Web service when description documents for the XML Web service are generated, such as the Service Description and the Service help page. ## Examples 在下面的示例中，字符串 `Obtains the Server Computer Name` 用于描述 XML Web service 的服务说明和服务帮助页中的 XML Web service 方法。In the example below, the string `Obtains the Server Computer Name` is used to describe the XML Web service method in the Service Description and Service help page for the XML Web service. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic WebMethodAttribute.Description Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.Description Example/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic WebMethodAttribute.Description Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.Description Example/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

MemberSignature.Value: public bool EnableSession { get; set; }
.property instance bool EnableSession
Public Property EnableSession As Boolean
public: property bool EnableSession { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.EnableSession : bool with get, set

summary.span: 指示是否为 XML Web service 方法启用会话状态。

span.span: Indicates whether session state is enabled for an XML Web service method.

value.span: 如果为 XML Web services 方法启用会话状态，则为 。

span.span: if session state is enabled for an XML Web service method.
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 为了将会话状态存储在 ASP.NET 对象中 ，XML Web service 必须继承自 ，并应用于 XML Web service 方法，并将 属性设置为 `true` 。In order to store session state in the ASP.NET object, the XML Web service must inherit from and a applied to the XML Web service method, setting the property to `true`. 如果 XML Web service 方法不需要会话状态，则禁用它可能会提高性能。If session state is not needed for an XML Web service method, then disabling it may improve performance. XML Web service 客户端由 XML Web service 返回的 HTTP cookie 唯一标识。An XML Web service client is uniquely identified by an HTTP cookie returned by an XML Web service. 为了使 XML Web service 维护客户端的会话状态，客户端必须保持 cookie。In order for an XML Web service to maintain session state for a client, the client must persist the cookie. 客户端可以在调用 XML Web service 方法之前，通过创建新的实例 并将其分配给代理类的属性，来接收 HTTP cookie 。Clients can receive the HTTP cookie by creating a new instance of and assigning that to the property of the proxy class before calling the XML Web service method. 如果你需要在代理类实例超出范围时维持会话状态，则客户端必须在调用 XML Web service 之间保持 HTTP cookie。If you need to maintain session state beyond when the proxy class instance goes out of scope, the client must persist the HTTP cookie between calls to the XML Web service. 例如，Web 窗体客户端可以通过将 其保存在其自己的会话状态中，来保存 HTTP cookie。For instance, a Web Forms client can persist the HTTP cookie by saving the in its own session state. 由于并非所有 XML Web services 都使用会话状态，因此客户端不一定总是需要使用 客户端代理的属性，因此 XML Web service 的文档应指出是否使用会话状态。Because not all XML Web services use session state and thus clients are not always required to use the property of a client proxy, the documentation for the XML Web service should state whether session state is used. ## Examples 下面的示例使用会话状态来确定特定会话访问 XML Web service 方法的次数 `SessionHitCounter` 。The example below uses session state to determine how many times a particular session accesses the XML Web service method `SessionHitCounter`. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic WebMethodAttribute.EnableSession Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.EnableSession Example/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic WebMethodAttribute.EnableSession Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.EnableSession Example/VB/sourcevb.asmx)] 下面的代码示例是使用会话状态的 XML Web service 的 Web 窗体客户端。The following code example is a Web Forms client of an XML Web service that uses session state. 客户端通过将会话存储在客户端的会话状态中，来保存唯一标识该会话的 HTTP cookie。The client persists the HTTP cookie that uniquely identifies the session by storing it in the client's session state. [!code-aspx-csharp[HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer/CS/serverusageclientcs.aspx#1)] [!code-aspx-vb[HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/HttpWebClientProtocol.CookieContainer/VB/serverusageclientvb.aspx#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public string MessageName { get; set; }
.property instance string MessageName
Public Property MessageName As String
public: property System::String ^ MessageName { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.MessageName : string with get, set

summary.span: 在传递到 XML Web service 方法和从 XML Web service 方法返回的数据中用于 XML Web service 方法的名称。

span.span: The name used for the XML Web service method in the data passed to and returned from an XML Web service method.

value.span: 在传递到 XML Web services 方法和从 XML Web services 方法返回的数据中用于 XML Web services 方法的名称。

span.span: The name used for the XML Web service method in the data passed to and from an XML Web service method.

value.span: 默认值是 XML Web services 方法的名称。

span.span: The default is the name of the XML Web service method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 属性可用于对方法或属性名称使用别名。The property can be used to alias method or property names. 属性的最常见用途 是唯一标识多态方法。The most common use of the property will be to uniquely identify polymorphic methods. 默认情况下， 设置为 XML Web service 方法的名称。By default, is set to the name of the XML Web service method. 因此，如果 XML Web service 包含具有相同名称的两个或多个 XML Web service 方法，则可以通过将设置为在 XML Web service 中唯一的名称来唯一标识各个 XML Web service 方法 ，而无需在代码中更改实际方法名称的名称。Therefore, if an XML Web service contains two or more XML Web service methods with the same name, you can uniquely identify the individual XML Web service methods by setting the to a name unique within the XML Web service, without changing the name of the actual method name in code. 当数据传递到 XML Web service 时，它将在请求中发送，并在响应中发送数据。When data is passed to an XML Web service it is sent in a request and when it is returned it is sent in a response. 在请求和响应中，用于 XML Web service 方法的名称是其 属性。Within the request and response, the name used for the XML Web service method is its property. 与 XML Web service 方法关联的消息名称在 XML Web service 中必须是唯一的。The message name associated with an XML Web service method must be unique within the XML Web service. 如果在客户端调用原始方法后添加了具有相同名称但具有不同参数的新 XML Web service 方法，则应为新方法指定不同的消息名称，但原始消息名称应保持不变，以确保与现有客户端的兼容性。If a new XML Web service method with the same name but different parameters is added after clients are calling the original method, a different message name should be specified for the new method but the original message name should be left as is to ensure compatibility with existing clients. ## Examples 在下面的示例中， 用于区分这两种 `Add` 方法。In the example below, is used to disambiguate the two `Add` methods. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic WebMethodAttribute.MessageName Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.MessageName Example/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic WebMethodAttribute.MessageName Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.MessageName Example/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]

summary.span: 指示 XML Web service 方法的事务支持。

span.span: Indicates the transaction support of an XML Web service method.

value.span: XML Web services 方法的事务支持。

span.span: The transaction support of an XML Web service method.
The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks 由于 HTTP 协议的无状态特性，XML Web service 方法只能作为事务中的根对象参与。XML Web service methods can only participate as the root object in a transaction, due to the stateless nature of the HTTP protocol. 如果 COM 对象标记为在 "组件服务" 管理工具中的事务内运行，XML Web service 方法可以调用与 XML Web service 方法参与同一事务的 COM 对象。XML Web service methods can invoke COM objects that participate in the same transaction as the XML Web service method, if the COM object is marked to run within a transaction in the Component Services administrative tool. 如果 XML Web service 方法（其 属性为或 `Required` `RequiresNew` ）调用另一个 XML Web service 方法（ 其属性为 `Required` 或 `RequiresNew` ），则每个 XML Web service 方法将参与其自己的事务，因为 XML Web service 方法只能充当事务中的根对象。If an XML Web service method with a property of `Required` or `RequiresNew` invokes another XML Web service method with a property of `Required` or `RequiresNew`, each XML Web service method participates in its own transaction, because an XML Web service method can only act as the root object in a transaction. |项Item|说明Description| |----------|-----------------| |已禁用Disabled|指示 XML Web service 方法不在事务范围内运行。Indicates that the XML Web service method does not run within the scope of a transaction. 处理请求时，将在没有事务的情况下执行 XML Web service 方法。When a request is processed, the XML Web service method is executed without a transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.Disabled`) ][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.Disabled`)]| |NotSupportedNotSupported|指示 XML Web service 方法不在事务范围内运行。Indicates that the XML Web service method does not run within the scope of a transaction. 处理请求时，将在没有事务的情况下执行 XML Web service 方法。When a request is processed, the XML Web service method is executed without a transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.NotSupported`) ][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.NotSupported`)]| |支持Supported|指示 XML Web service 方法不在事务范围内运行。Indicates that the XML Web service method does not run within the scope of transactions. 处理请求时，将创建不带事务的 XML Web service。When a request is processed, the XML Web service is created without a transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.Supported`) ][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.Supported`)]| |必需Required|指示 XML Web service 方法需要事务。Indicates that the XML Web service method requires a transaction. 由于 XML Web service 方法只能作为事务中的根对象参与，将为 XML Web service 方法创建新的事务。Since XML Web service methods can only participate as the root object in a transaction, a new transaction will be created for the XML Web service method.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.Required`) ][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.Required`)]| |RequiresNewRequiresNew|指示 XML Web service 方法需要新的事务。Indicates that the XML Web service method requires a new transaction. 处理请求时，将在新事务中创建 XML Web service。When a request is processed, the XML Web service is created within a new transaction.

[WebMethod (TransactionOption = `TransactionOption.RequiresNew`) ][WebMethod(TransactionOption= `TransactionOption.RequiresNew`)]| 如果 XML Web service 方法引发异常或未捕获异常，则会自动中止事务。If an exception is thrown from or not caught by an XML Web service method, the transaction is automatically aborted. 如果没有发生异常，则自动提交事务，除非方法显式调用 `SetAbort` 。If no exceptions occur the transaction is automatically committed unless the method explicitly calls `SetAbort`. ## Examples 下面的示例在调用方法时开始一个新事务 `Transfer` 。The example below begins a new transaction when the `Transfer` method is called. [!code-aspx-csharp[Classic WebMethodAttribute.TransactionOption Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.TransactionOption Example/CS/sourcecs.asmx)] [!code-aspx-vb[Classic WebMethodAttribute.TransactionOption Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Remoting/Classic WebMethodAttribute.TransactionOption Example/VB/sourcevb.asmx)]
